item.title: kate add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: kate add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: kate add a quote by Erik Satie
item.description: "I am by far your superior, but my notorious modesty prevents me from saying so." -- Erik Satie

item.title: kate add a quote by Leonora Carrington
item.description: "We went down into the silent garden. Dawn is the time when nothing breathes, the hour of silence. Everything is transfixed, only the light moves." -- Leonora Carrington

item.title: kate add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: kate add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "On the moon we wore feathers in our hair, and rubies on our hands. On the moon we had gold spoons." -- Shirley Jackson

item.title: kate add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?" -- Albert Camus

item.title: kate add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: kate add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "My mother says that pain is hidden in everyone you see. She says try to imagine it like big bunches of flowers that everyone is carrying around with them. Think of your pain like a big bunch of red roses, a beautiful thorn necklace. Everyone has one." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: kate add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
kate add a quote by Herman Hesse
item.description: "When someone seeks," said Siddhartha, "then it easily happens that his eyes see only the thing that he seeks, and he is able to find nothing, to take in nothing because he always thinks only about the thing he is seeking, because he has one goal, because he is obsessed with his goal. Seeking means: having a goal. But finding means: being free, being open, having no goal." -- Herman Hesse

item.title: kate add a quote by Georges Bataille
item.description: "I believe that truth has only one face: that of a violent contradiction." -- Georges Bataille

item.title: kate add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "One does not become enlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: kate add a quote by C.G. Jung
item.description: "Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes." -- C.G. Jung

item.title: kate add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself." -- Henry Miller

item.title: kate add a quote by Leopold von Sacher-Masoch
item.description: "Love knows no virtue, no merit; it loves and forgives and tolerates everything because it must. We are not guided by reason..." -- Leopold von Sacher-Masoch

item.title: kate add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: kate add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: kate add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Until i die there will be these moments, moments seeming to rise up out of the ground like Macbeth's witches, when his face will come before me, that face in all its changes, when the exact timbre of his voice and tricks of his speech will nearly burst my ears, when his smell will overpower my nostrils. Sometimes, in the days which are coming--God grant me the grace to live them--in the glare of the grey morning, sour-mouthed, eyelids raw and red, hair tangled and damp from my stormy sleep, facing, over coffee and cigarette smoke, last night's impenetrable, meaningless boy who will shortly rise and vanish like the smoke, I will see Giovanni again, as he was that night, so vivid, so winning, all of the light of that gloomy tunnel trapped around his head." -- James Baldwin

item.title: kate add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: kate add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "A kiss about apple pie a la mode with the vanilla creaminess melting in the pie heat. A kiss about chocolate, when you haven't eaten chocolate in a year. A kiss about palm trees speeding by, trailing pink clouds when you drive down the Strip sizzling with champagne. A kiss about spotlights fanning the sky and the swollen sea spilling like tears all over your legs." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: kate add a quote by Yukio Mishima
item.description: "The instant that the blade tore open his flesh, the bright disk of the sun soared up and exploded behind his eyelids." -- Yukio Mishima

item.title: kate add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "I felt once more how simple and frugal a thing is happiness: a glass of wine, a roast chestnut, a wretched little brazier, the sound of the sea. Nothing else." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: kate add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: kate add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart. The really great men must, I think, have great sadness on earth." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: kate add a quote by Ben Jonson
kate add a quote by James A. Baldwin
item.description: "Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up." -- James A. Baldwin

item.title: kate add a quote by Janet Frame
item.description: "There is no past or future. Using tenses to divide time is like making chalk marks on water." -- Janet Frame

item.title: kate add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "The apparition of these faces in the crowd; Petals on a wet black bough." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: kate add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower." -- Albert Camus
